comment.author: 32162360@N00
32162360@N00
comment._content: Later a hospital ship - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/maryblathwayt/3007469973/] Hit by a German torpedo in 1917, and rebuilt as the 'Arcadian' - www.roll-of-honour.com/Ships/HMHSAsturias.html

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] A ship with an interesting career :) It appears that this vessel was in at least Sydney twice during March 1908 & checking newspapers and the Daily Commercial News and Shipping the times are not often noted unfortunately. In regards to whether it is arriving or departing, could go either way! Due to it’s trimming being just a bit high in the bows (see waterline position), maybe the coal supplies are down, in which case its coming in. Gangways are out (but could be being stowed) and there is loose cargo at the edge of the wharf which would suggest it is there to be loaded - however none of this answers the question with certainty! The educated guess from the folks here is that the vessel is arriving which may make it 7 March 1908.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
